meanings.definition: To press or squeeze with great force
meanings.sent1: She was crushing the grapes to make juice.
meanings.sent2: The bulldozer was crushing the rocks into small pieces.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to delicious juice was crushing the fruits with care.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to be crushing down on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The hydraulic press was crushing the metal with a loud noise.

meanings.sent1: The crushing heat made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The team faced a crushing defeat in the final match.
meanings.sent3: The amount of homework she had was crushing, but she tackled it one step at a time.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident was a crushing blow to the family.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the responsibility felt crushing on his young shoulders.

meanings.sent1: The army was crushing the enemy forces in battle.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer was known for crushing his opponents in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The cat was crushing the mouse toy during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The student was crushing the math problems one after another.
meanings.sent5: The waves were crushing against the shore with great power.

meanings.definition: To cause great emotional or mental distress
meanings.sent1: The rejection letter was crushing for her dreams.
meanings.sent2: The loss of a loved one can be a crushing experience.
meanings.sent3: The thought of failing the test was crushing, but she studied hard.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism was crushing his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The weight of guilt was crushing him, making it hard to move forward.
